page.title: 18RELIGION(cont.)
page.content:
THE GREYFRIAR'S FRANCISCAN MONASTERY The Franciscan Monastery was opened in 1892. At the moment there are only ten friars living there. The Franciscan Friars own 4-5 acres of land. They grow some of their own vegetables and they own some chickens. In their leisure time , they can read, watch T.V., play sports, visit their families and go for walks. For some of these activities they can change from their habits into casual clothes.
Other organisations:The British Red Cross Centre at Barnett Hill has been there since 1946.It trains people in Red Cross concerns from all over the country. Scouting/Guides:There are two Guide companies,two Brownie packs, one group of Rangers,one Scout troop,one Cub pack and a Red Cross unit.
